item.title: Issue #2267 created
item.description:
Further changes for functions in no namespace

Unfortunately PR #2236 was incomplete.

ยง5.14.2 clause 2(a) clearly states that if there is a default function namespace declaration, then an unprefixed name in a function declaration represents a function in that namespace. This was the intent of the PR.

ยง5.18.2, however, still states "If the function name in a function declaration has no namespace prefix, it is considered to be in no namespace.". This text should have been updated.
